text:
DO NOT GIVE ME HIGH-LEVEL THEORY. IF I ASK FOR A FIX OR EXPLANATION, I WANT ACTUAL CODE OR EXPLANATION!!! I DON'T WANT "Here's how you can blablabla"

Be casual unless otherwise specified
Be terse and concise
Suggest solutions that I didn’t think about—anticipate my needs
Treat me as an expert
Be accurate and thorough
Give the answer immediately. Provide detailed explanations and restate my query in your own words if necessary after giving the answer
Value good arguments over authorities, the source is irrelevant
Consider new technologies and contrarian ideas, not just conventional wisdom
You may use high levels of speculation or prediction, just flag it for me
No moral lectures
Discuss safety only when it's crucial and non-obvious
If your content policy is an issue, provide the closest acceptable response and explain the content policy issue afterward
Cite sources whenever possible at the end, not inline
No need to mention your knowledge cutoff
No need to disclose you're an AI
Please respect my prettier preferences when you provide code
Split into multiple responses if one response isn't enough to answer the question
Focus on readability over being performant
Fully implement all requested functionality
Leave NO todos, placeholders, or missing pieces


```ts lokal-link-be/src/features/shops/dto/query-shop.dto.ts
import { z } from "zod";

export const ShopQueryDto = z.object({
  search: z.string().optional(),
  sortBy: z.enum(["name", "createdAt", "followersCount"])
    .optional(),
  sortOrder: z.enum(["asc", "desc"])
    .optional(),
  ownerProfileId: z.string().uuid()
    .optional(),
  slug: z.string()
    .optional(),
  includeAddresses: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  includeSchedules: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  page: z.number().min(1)
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().regex(/^\d+$/).transform(Number))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  pageSize: z.number()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().regex(/^\d+$/).transform(Number))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
});

export type ShopQueryDto = z.infer<typeof ShopQueryDto>;

export function parseShopQuery(input: ShopQueryDto) {
  return {
    search: input.search,
    sortBy: input.sortBy as "name" | "createdAt" | "followersCount" | undefined,
    sortOrder: input.sortOrder as "asc" | "desc" | undefined,
    ownerProfileId: input.ownerProfileId,
    slug: input.slug,
    includeAddresses: input.includeAddresses === "true",
    includeSchedules: input.includeSchedules === "true",
    page: input.page ? parseInt(input.page, 10) : undefined,
    pageSize: input.pageSize ? parseInt(input.pageSize, 10) : undefined,
  };
}
```

```ts lokal-link-be/src/features/products/dto/query-product.dto.ts
import { z } from "zod";

export const ProductQueryDto = z.object({
  search: z.string().optional(),
  sortBy: z.enum(["name", "createdAt", "basePrice", "inventory"])
    .optional(),
  sortOrder: z.enum(["asc", "desc"])
    .optional(),
  page: z.number().min(1)
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().regex(/^\d+$/).transform(Number))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  pageSize: z.number()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().regex(/^\d+$/).transform(Number))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  slug: z.string()
    .optional(),
  sku: z.string()
    .optional(),
  isActive: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  includeVariants: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  includeCategories: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
  includeImages: z.boolean()
    .optional()
    .or(z.string().transform((val) => val === "true"))
    .transform((value) => value?.toString()),
});

export type ProductQueryDto = z.infer<typeof ProductQueryDto>;

export function parseProductQueryDto(
  input: ProductQueryDto,
) {
  return {
    
  }
}
```

make the parseShopQuery function as reference 
can you also make the parseProductQuery 
```ts
export function parseProductQueryDto(input: ProductQueryDto) {
  return {
    search: input.search,
    sortBy: input.sortBy as "name" | "createdAt" | "basePrice" | "inventory" | undefined,
    sortOrder: input.sortOrder as "asc" | "desc" | undefined,
    page: input.page ? parseInt(input.page, 10) : undefined,
    pageSize: input.pageSize ? parseInt(input.pageSize, 10) : undefined,
    slug: input.slug,
    sku: input.sku,
    isActive: input.isActive === "true",
    includeVariants: input.includeVariants === "true",
    includeCategories: input.includeCategories === "true",
    includeImages: input.includeImages === "true",
  };
}
```
